newsitem.title: UK: BA cargo strike recovery could take 1-3 days.
newsitem.headline: BA cargo strike recovery could take 1-3 days.

text.p: British Airways PLC World Cargo said it could it take one to three days to return to normal operations, if the 72 hour strike by the carrier's cabin crew goes ahead on Wednesday.
BA Cargo will honour permanent cargo bookings on passenger flights scheduled to operate during the 72 hour cabin crew strike due to start early on Wednesday, a spokesman told Reuters.
Freighter flights will operate normally during the strike.

"But on other routes we will be unable to accept cargo bookings during the period of the strike. We will accept bookings as soon as possible afterwards but expect it will be one to three days before there is a full recovery," the spokesman added.
"The flights which operate will remain open for cargo and mail and we will also offer capacity for sale. This should be booked normally through BA Cargo's reservation offices," he said.
"However we will not be able accept bookings for either livestock or human remains until further notice," he added.

He said that customers who had reservations for cargo on flights which would not operate had been told their cargo could not be accepted and "they have had time to book alternative routes or rebook at a later date."
BA World Cargo customers received a letter late yesterday setting out the carrier's plans, the spokesman added. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
